Package graphanalyzer.model.algorithms

Class StronglyConnectedComponentsAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphanalyzer.model.algorithms.StronglyConnectedComponentsAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm, java.io.Serializable
    public class StronglyConnectedComponentsAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
implements Algorithm, java.io.Serializable
    Implementation of a graph algorithm that calculates strongly connected components based on two depth-first-searches.

    This algorithm finds strongly connected components in a given graph. It does so by traversing the graph in a depth first search. Finished vertices get added to a stack. After transposing the graph and unvisiting all vertices a second depth first search is started. But this time the vertices are visited recording to their position in the stack. A depth first search from the top level item of the stack is started and every vertex that has been found on this search is part of the same strongly connected component. The algorithm uses the fact that a strongly connected component of a given graph G is also a strongly connected component in its transpose G(T).

    Author:
    Paul Ehler
    See Also:
    Strongly connected component (Wikipedia), Serialized Form

      • dfsVisit

        private void dfsVisit​(DirectedGraph g,
                      Vertex v,
                      boolean isSecondRun,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> set)
        This method implements the visit of the depth first search.

        It is implemented so that it can be used for both the first and the second DFS. Therefore the graph, a boolean that determines whether it is the second DFS or not and a set that will be filled with sccs gets passed.

        Parameters:
        g - the graph to work on
        v - currently visited vertex
        isSecondRun - whether it is first or second dfs
        set - a set the sccs get saved to
